intro: Ouratea culminicola, commonly known as the cloud forest Ouratea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
